org.jetel.util.file

Class WcardPattern

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.util.file.WcardPattern

  • public class WcardPattern
extends java.lang.Object
    Since:
    09/05/06 Class generating collection of filenames which match given wildcard patterns. The pattern may describe either relative or absolute filenames. '*' represents any count of characters, '?' represents one character. Wildcards cannot be followed by directory separators.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WcardPattern

        public WcardPattern()
        Constructor. Creates instance with empty set of patterns. It doesn't match any filenames initially.

      • splitFilePattern

        public static void splitFilePattern(java.lang.String pat,
                    java.lang.StringBuffer dir,
                    java.lang.StringBuffer filePat)
        Splits specified pattern in two parts - directory which cannot contain any wildcard and filename pattern containing wildcards. When specified pattern doesn't contain any wildcards, doesn't do anything.
        Parameters:
        pat - Pattern to be split.
        dir - Directory name.
        filePat - Filename pattern.

      • resolveAllNames

        public void resolveAllNames(boolean resolveAllNames)
        Sets if the method filenames resolves server paths.
        Parameters:
        resolveAllNames -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • filenames

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> filenames()
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Generates filenames matching current set of patterns.
        Returns:
        Set of matching filenames. Absolute path is returned for URL with wildcard. Relative path is returned for URL without wildcard.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getArchiveURLMatcher

        public static java.util.regex.Matcher getArchiveURLMatcher(java.lang.String source)
        Finds embedded source. Example: source: zip:http://linuxweb/~jausperger/employees.dat.zip#employees0.dat result: (g1) zip: (g2) http://linuxweb/~jausperger/employees.dat.zip (g3) #employees0.dat
        Parameters:
        source - - input/output source
        Returns:
        matcher or null
